717899f.text:
Bryant Park, looking east from Sixth Avenue at 41st Street, with the New York Public Library and the skyscrapers of the Grand Central area in the background, and ahowing the Fark as remodelled under Park Commissioner Robert Moses. The flower beds are mostly planted with ivy. The fountain has been moved west from its old position in front of the seated statue of William Cullen Bryant, by Herbert Adams, 1911. For a numben of years the only statue in Bryant Park was s bust of Washington Irving, which seems to have disappeared
in this latest rearrangement.
Spring 1935.
TfWaVe V-y No ino 2 69 . a S E
N.g. f LGVWevy

717898f-a.text:
Bryant Park, from but not including 41st to but not including 40th Streets, showing a view of almost the entire park east from Sixth Ave., to the rear of the New York Public Library. At the right, the view shows 42nd Street, north side, west of, adjoining. and at the N.W. corner of Fifth Avh. and at the left of the picture is shown 40th Street, west of, adjoining, and at the S.W.
corner of Fifth Ave.
1935.
New York Public Library.
Schwartz.

709467f-b.text:
Sixth Avenue, north from West 4lst Street,
showing demolition of the "El" station at 42nd Street.
View 2 is from a point slightly to the
south of 4lst Street and includes a section of track that is simultaneously being raoed. Bryant Park is to the right. Note the Hippodrome Building standing. This will disappear
in the Fall.
April 5, 1939
Views 1, 2
P. L. Sperr
